meanings.sent1: She kept overdocumenting the project, making it hard to find the important details.
meanings.sent2: I tend to overdocument my expenses to ensure I have all the receipts.
meanings.sent3: The detective overdocumenting every tiny clue made the case seem like a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: His habit of overdocumenting every conversation turned his notebook into a mountain of words.
meanings.sent5: The student's tendency to overdocument every fact made studying overwhelming.

meanings.definition: The act of recording too much information.
meanings.sent1: Overdocumenting can lead to confusion when trying to find specific details.
meanings.sent2: The overdocumenting of historical events ensures that no detail is left out.
meanings.sent3: The overdocumenting of the family vacation made the photo album burst at the seams.
meanings.sent4: The overdocumenting of the crime scene turned the investigation into a tedious process.
meanings.sent5: The overdocumenting of the meeting minutes made the report thicker than a novel.
